00068 // the geometry methods of cones are fairly CPU intensive
00069 // => we will not bother to use templates to have separate
00070 // versions for x-cones, y-cones, etc.
00071 
00102 class EGS_CONES_EXPORT EGS_SimpleCone : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00103 
00104 protected:
00105 
00106     EGS_Vector    xo;          // the cone apex.
00107     EGS_Vector    a;           // the cone axis.
00108     EGS_Float     gamma, g12;  // tangent of opening angle and 1+gamma^2
00109     EGS_Float     g12i;        // 1/sqrt(g12)
00110     EGS_Float     d1;          // (-) closing plane distance (if closed)
00111     EGS_Float     Ro, Ro2;     // radius at base (if closed) and Ro^2
00112     bool          open;        // true if cone is open
00113     bool          is_cyl;      // true if cone is cylindrical (within hard-coded tolerance)
00114     static string type;
00115 
00116 public:
00117 
00118     // constructor
00119     EGS_SimpleCone(const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, EGS_Float Gamma,
00120                    const EGS_Float *distance=0, const string &N="")
00121 
00122         : EGS_BaseGeometry(N), xo(Xo), a(A), gamma(Gamma), g12(1+Gamma*Gamma),
00123           open(true), is_cyl(false) {
00124 
00125         a.normalize();
00126         g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00127 
00128         // closed cone
00129         if (distance) {
00130             if (*distance > 0) {
00131                 open = false;
00132                 d1 = -(*distance);
00133                 Ro = -d1*gamma;
00134                 Ro2 = Ro*Ro;
00135             }
00136             else {
00137                 egsWarning("EGS_SimpleCone: the distance to the closing plane must be positive\n");
00138             }
00139         }
00140         nreg = 1;
00141     }
00142 
00143     // constructor
00144     EGS_SimpleCone(const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, EGS_Float dz,
00145                    EGS_Float Rtop, EGS_Float Rbottom, bool Open=true, const string &N="")
00146 
00147         : EGS_BaseGeometry(N), a(A), open(Open), is_cyl(false) {
00148 
00149         a.normalize();
00150 
00151         // avoid round-off problems.
00152         if (fabs(Rtop - Rbottom) < 2e-5) {          // flag cylinders to avoid round-off problems
00153             is_cyl = true;
00154             xo = Xo;
00155             Ro = Rtop;
00156             Ro2 = Ro*Ro;
00157             gamma = 0;
00158             g12 = 1;
00159             g12i = 1;
00160             d1 = -dz;
00161         }
00162         else if (Rtop < Rbottom) {                  // cone is opening along axis vector a
00163             EGS_Float aux = dz*Rtop/(Rbottom-Rtop);
00164             xo = Xo - a*aux;
00165             gamma = Rbottom/(aux+dz);
00166             g12 = 1 + gamma*gamma;
00167             g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00168             d1 = -dz-aux;
00169         }
00170         else {                                      // cone is closing along axis vector a
00171             EGS_Float aux = dz*Rbottom/(Rtop-Rbottom);
00172             xo = Xo + a*(aux+dz);
00173             a *= (-1);
00174             gamma = Rtop/(aux+dz);
00175             g12 = 1 + gamma*gamma;
00176             g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00177             d1 = -dz-aux;
00178         }
00179     }
00180 
00181     // destructor
00182     ~EGS_SimpleCone() {}
00183 
00184     // isInside
00185     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00186 
00187         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);                        // vector from cone apex xo to test point x
00188         EGS_Float  aa = xp*a;                       // projection of xp on axis vector a
00189 
00190         // check bounds along cone axis
00191         if (!open && (aa < 0 || aa+d1 > 0)) {
00192             return false;
00193         }
00194 
00195         // check cylinder radius
00196         if (is_cyl) {
00197             EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2() - aa*aa;
00198             if (r2 <= Ro2) {
00199                 return true;
00200             }
00201             return false;
00202         }
00203 
00204         // check cone radius
00205         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
00206         if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12) {
00207             return true;
00208         }
00209         return false;
00210     }
00211 
00212     // isWhere
00213     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00214         if (isInside(x)) {
00215             return 0;
00216         }
00217         return -1;
00218     }
00219 
00220     // inside
00221     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00222         return isWhere(x);
00223     }
00224 
00225     // howfar
00226     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00227                EGS_Float &t, int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00228 
00229         EGS_Vector  xp(x-xo);                       // vector from cone apex xo to test point x
00230         EGS_Float   aa = xp*a;                      // projection of xp on cone axis a
00231         EGS_Float   b  = u*a;                       // cos(t) between axis a and step vector u
00232         EGS_Float   r2 = xp.length2();              // length^2 of xp
00233         EGS_Float   c  = u*xp;                      // projection of xp on step vector u
00234 
00235         // handle cylinder
00236         if (is_cyl) {
00237 
00238             // u is parallel to a (u and a are normalized)
00239             if (fabs(b) >= 1) {
00240                 return ireg;
00241             }
00242 
00243             EGS_Float A = 1 - b*b;                  // A = 1-cos^2(t) = sin^2(t)
00244             EGS_Float B = c - b*aa;                 // B = u * [xp - (xp*a)a] =  u * n
00245             EGS_Float C = r2 - aa*aa - Ro2;         // C = n^2 - R0^2
00246             EGS_Float d;                            // distance to cylinder along u
00247 
00248             // from inside cylinder
00249             if (!ireg) {
00250                 EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;              // R0^2 - [ n^2 - ((n*u)/sint)^2 ]
00251                 if (D < 0 || (C > 0 && B > 0)) {
00252                     d = 0;
00253                 }
00254                 // ^ hopefully a precision problem.
00255                 else {
00256                     d = B<=0 ? (sqrt(D)-B)/A : -C/(sqrt(D)+B);
00257                 }
00258             }
00259             // from outside cylinder
00260             else {
00261                 if (C < 0) {                        // inside cylinder: fp precision error
00262                     if (B < 0) {
00263                         d = 0;    // assume we are on the cylinder
00264                     }
00265                     else {
00266                         return ireg;    // u points away from cylinder
00267                     }
00268                 }
00269                 else {
00270                     if (B >= 0) {
00271                         return ireg;    // u points away from cylinder
00272                     }
00273                     EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;          // R0^2 - [ n^2 - ((n*u)/sint)^2 ]
00274                     if (D < 0) {
00275                         return ireg;    // u line does not intersect cylinder
00276                     }
00277                     d = C/(sqrt(D)-B);              // solve (n + d*(u-a(u*a)))^2 - R0^2 = 0
00278                 }
00279             }
00280 
00281             // distance to cylinder is longer than step length
00282             if (d > t) {
00283                 return ireg;
00284             }
00285 
00286             // intersection with cylinder is beyond boundary planes
00287             if (!open) {
00288                 EGS_Float aux = aa + d*b;
00289                 if (aux < 0 || aux+d1 > 0) {
00290                     return ireg;
00291                 }
00292             }
00293 
00294             // intersect with cylinder
00295             t = d;
00296             if (newmed && ireg < 0) {
00297                 *newmed = med;
00298             }
00299             if (normal) {
00300                 EGS_Float lam = aa+b*d;
00301                 EGS_Vector aux(xp+u*d-a*lam);
00302                 aux.normalize();
00303                 *normal = ireg < 0 ? aux : aux*(-1);
00304             }
00305 
00306             return (!ireg ? -1 : 0);
00307         }
00308 
00309         // handle odd case where position numerically coincides with apex
00310         if (!xp.length2()) {
00311 
00312             int inew;
00313 
00314             // u is aiming inside the cone angle
00315             if (b >= g12i) {                        // g12i = cos(t_cone); b = cos(t)
00316                 inew = 0;
00317                 if (ireg < 0) {                     // we are coming from outside
00318                     t = 0;
00319                     if (newmed) {
00320                         *newmed = med;
00321                     }
00322                     if (normal) {
00323                         *normal = a*(-1);
00324                     }
00325                 }
00326                 else if (!open && b>0) {            // check closing plane
00327                     EGS_Float tt = -d1/b;           // tt = -(aa + d1)/b but aa=0 if here
00328                     if (tt <= t) {
00329                         t = tt;
00330                         inew = -1;
00331                         if (normal) {
00332                             *normal = a*(-1);
00333                         }
00334                     }
00335                 }
00336             }
00337             // u is aiming outside the cone angle
00338             else {
00339                 inew = -1;
00340                 if (ireg >= 0) {                    // we are coming from inside
00341                     t = 0;
00342                     if (normal) {
00343                         *normal = a;
00344                     }
00345                 }
00346             }
00347 
00348             // return new region index
00349             return inew;
00350         }
00351 
00352         // handle closing plane
00353         if (!open) {
00354 
00355             // from outside cone
00356             if (ireg < 0) {
00357                 if (aa+d1 > 0 && b < 0) {           // outside closing plane, moving towards it
00358                     EGS_Float tt = -(aa+d1)/b;      // distance to closing plane
00359                     if (tt <= t) {
00360                         EGS_Float r2p = r2 + tt*(tt + 2*c);
00361                         if (r2p <= d1*d1*g12) {     // enter via the closing plane
00362                             if (newmed) {
00363                                 *newmed = med;
00364                             }
00365                             if (normal) {
00366                                 *normal = a;
00367                             }
00368                             t = tt;
00369                             return 0;
00370                         }
00371                     }
00372 
00373                     // if we are inside the conical surface, the only way to enter is via the
00374                     // closing plane. but if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12), we didn't enter: simply return
00375                     if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12) {
00376                         return ireg;
00377                     }
00378                 }
00379             }
00380             // from inside cone
00381             else {
00382                 if (b > 0) {                        // moving towards the closing plane.
00383                     EGS_Float tt = -(aa+d1)/b;      // distance to closing plane
00384                     if (tt <= t) {
00385                         EGS_Float r2p = r2 + tt*(tt + 2*c);
00386                         if (r2p <= d1*d1*g12) {     // exit via the closing plane
00387                             if (newmed) {
00388                                 *newmed = -1;
00389                             }
00390                             if (normal) {
00391                                 *normal = a*(-1);
00392                             }
00393                             t = tt;
00394                             return -1;
00395                         }
00396                     }
00397                 }
00398             }
00399         }
00400 
00401         // At this point, we cannot enter or exit via the closing plane; all we need to check
00402         // is the conical surface. solve for t: (x+t*u)^2 = g12*[(x+t*u)*a]^2 (i.e., point
00403         // x+t*u is on cone surface).
00404         // solution: t = (-B +- sqrt(B^2-A*C))/A
00405 
00406         EGS_Float A   = 1 - b*b*g12;                // 1 - cos^2(t)/cos^2(t_cone)
00407         EGS_Float B   = c - aa*b*g12;
00408         EGS_Float C   = r2 - aa*aa*g12;
00409         EGS_Float tt  = 1e30;
00410         EGS_Float lam = -1;
00411 
00412         if (fabs(A) < 1e-6) {
00413             // moving parallel to the cone surface (A=0, within hard-coded tolerance):
00414             // solution: t = -C/(2*B), if t>0
00415 
00416             if ((!ireg && B>0) || (ireg && B<0)) {
00417                 EGS_Float ttt = -C/(2*B);           // solution
00418                 lam = aa+b*ttt;                     // (x+t*u)*a >= 0: on "positive" cone
00419                 if (ttt >= 0 && lam >= 0) {
00420                     tt = ttt;    // distance to cone surface
00421                 }
00422             }
00423         }
00424         else {
00425             // general solution, guarding against numerical instability
00426             // solution: t = (-B +- sqrt(B^2-A*C))/A
00427             //
00428             // pick the smallest positive root
00429             // A*C > 0 => roots have same sign
00430             // A*C < 0 => roots have opposite sign
00431             //
00432             // if C<0, then if A>0 pick '+ root',
00433             //         else if A<0 we must have B>0 for positive roots: pick '+ root'
00434             //         (guard against cancellation if B>0)
00435             //
00436             // if C>0, then if A<0 roots have opposite signs: pick '- root' (-|A| flips sign)
00437             //         else if A>0 we must have B<0 for positive roots: pick '- root'
00438             //         (guard against cancellation if B<0)
00439             //
00440             // by testing for ireg instead of the sign of C, we:
00441             // 1) avoid numerical instability at C=0
00442             // 2) reverse the choice for the upper cone: largest positive root or negative one.
00443 
00444             EGS_Float ttt = -1;
00445             EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;                  // determinant
00446             if (D<0) {
00447                 return ireg;    // no real solution: no intersection
00448             }
00449 
00450             if (!ireg && !(A<0 && B<0)) {           // inside cone
00451                 if (B>0) {
00452                     ttt = -C/(B+sqrt(D));
00453                 }
00454                 else {
00455                     ttt = (sqrt(D)-B)/A;
00456                 }
00457             }
00458             else if (ireg && !(A>0 && B>0)) {       // outside cone
00459                 if (B<0) {
00460                     ttt = C/(sqrt(D)-B);
00461                 }
00462                 else {
00463                     ttt = -(sqrt(D)+B)/A;
00464                 }
00465             }
00466             else {
00467                 return ireg;    // no intersection
00468             }
00469 
00470             lam = aa+b*ttt;                         // (x+t*u)*a >= 0: on "positive" cone
00471             if (ttt >= -2e-5 && lam >= 0) {
00472                 tt = ttt;    // why the hard-coded -2e-5 bound??
00473             }
00474         }
00475 
00476         // distance too far, or intersection beyond bounding plane
00477         if (tt > t || (!open && ireg && d1 + aa + tt*b > 0)) {
00478             return ireg;
00479         }
00480 
00481 
00482         // set distance and new region
00483         t = tt;
00484         int inew = ireg ? 0 : -1;
00485 
00486         // set medium and surface normal
00487         if (newmed) {
00488             *newmed = inew ? -1 : med;
00489         }
00490         if (normal) {
00491             *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*g12);
00492             normal->normalize();
00493             if (!ireg) {
00494                 *normal *= (-1);
00495             }
00496         }
00497 
00498         // return new region
00499         return inew;
00500     }
00501 
00502 
00503     // hownear
00504     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00505 
00506         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);                        // position with respect to cone origin
00507         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                        // position along cone axis
00508         EGS_Float ag = aa*gamma;                    // cone radius at axis position
00509         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();                // distance squared to cone origin
00510 
00511         // cylindrical case
00512         if (is_cyl) {
00513 
00514             // open, or within bounding planes
00515             if (open || (aa > 0 && aa+d1 < 0)) {
00516                 r2 = sqrt(r2 - aa*aa);              // radial distance from axis
00517                 if (ireg) {
00518                     return r2-Ro;    // from outside
00519                 }
00520                 else {
00521                     return Ro-r2;    // from inside
00522                 }
00523             }
00524 
00525             r2 = sqrt(r2 - aa*aa);                  // radial distance from axis
00526 
00527             // inside the radius of cylinder: shortest distance is to closing plane
00528             if (r2 < Ro) {
00529                 if (aa<0) {
00530                     return -aa;    // distance to "0" closing plane
00531                 }
00532                 else {
00533                     return aa+d1;    // distance to "d1" closing plane
00534                 }
00535             }
00536 
00537             // outside the radius of cylinder: shortest distance is to cylinder cap "corner"
00538             EGS_Float aux = r2-Ro;
00539             if (aa<0) {
00540                 return sqrt(aa*aa + aux*aux);    // distance to "0" cap
00541             }
00542             EGS_Float tp = aa+d1;
00543             return sqrt(tp*tp + aux*aux);           // distance to "d1" cap
00544 
00545         }
00546 
00547         // inside "negative" cone lobe
00548         if (aa < 0 && ag*ag > r2*g12) {             // cone tip is the nearest point
00549             return sqrt(r2);
00550         }
00551 
00552         // compute useful distances
00553         EGS_Float r2a2 = r2-aa*aa;                  // distance^2 to cone axis
00554         EGS_Float r2a  = sqrt(r2a2);                // distance to cone axis
00555         EGS_Float tc = fabs((ag-r2a)*g12i);         // distance to cone (perp. to cone surface)
00556 
00557         // open cone: tc is the shortest distance
00558         if (open) {
00559             return tc;
00560         }
00561 
00562         // closed cone: check closing plane
00563         EGS_Float tp = d1+aa;                       // signed axial distance to closing plane
00564 
00565         // inside cone
00566         if (!ireg) {
00567             tp = -tp;                               // adjust sign of distance
00568             if (tp < tc) {
00569                 tc = tp;    // pick shortest distance
00570             }
00571         }
00572         // outside, but inside conical surface
00573         else if (tp > 0 && r2 < aa*aa*g12) {
00574             if (r2a2 > Ro2) {                       // outside the cone base cylinder
00575                 EGS_Float aux = r2a - Ro;
00576                 tc = sqrt(tp*tp + aux*aux);         // nearest point is cone base "corner"
00577             }
00578             else {
00579                 tc = tp;    // inside the cone base cylinder
00580             }
00581         }
00582         // outside, and outside conical surface
00583         else if (tp + tc*gamma*g12i > 0) {          // nearest point is cone base "corner"
00584             EGS_Float aux = r2a + d1*gamma;         // distance to cone base cylinder
00585             tc = sqrt(aux*aux + tp*tp);             // distance to cone base "corner"
00586         }
00587 
00588         // return shortest distance to cone
00589         return tc;
00590     }

00601     EGS_Vector getApex() const {
00602         return xo;
00603     }

00605     // getAxis accessor
00606     EGS_Vector getAxis() const {
00607         return a;
00608     }
00609 
00610     // getGamma accessor
00611     EGS_Float getGamma() const {
00612         return gamma;
00613     }
00614 
00615     // getRadius accessor
00616     EGS_Float getRadius(const EGS_Vector &x) const {
00617         if (is_cyl) {
00618             return Ro;
00619         }
00620         EGS_Float xp = (x-xo)*a;
00621         if (xp <= 0) {
00622             return 0;
00623         }
00624         return xp*gamma;
00625     }
00626 };

00628 
00629 // A set of cones having the same axis and opening angle and
00630 // apexes along the cone axis:
00631 //
00632 //          /\
00633 //         /  \
00634 //        /    \
00635 //       /  /\  \
00636 //      /  /  \  \
00637 //     /  /    \  \
00638 //    /  /  /\  \  \
00639 //   /  /  /  \  \  \
00640 //
00641 // That sort of geometry is useful for modelling e.g. the tip of
00642 // many ionization chambers.
00643 //
00644 
00671 class EGS_ParallelCones : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00672 
00673     EGS_Vector   *xo;           // the cone apexes
00674     EGS_Vector   a;             // the cone axis.
00675     EGS_Float    gamma, g12;    // tangent of opening angle and 1 + gamma^2
00676     EGS_Float    g12i;          // 1/sqrt(g12)
00677     EGS_Float    *d;            // distances from the first apex.
00678     int          nc;            // number of cones
00679     static string type;
00680 
00681 public:
00682 
00683     // constructor
00684     EGS_ParallelCones(int Nc, const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, EGS_Float Gamma,
00685                       const EGS_Float *distances, const string &N="")
00686 
00687         : EGS_BaseGeometry(N), a(A), gamma(Gamma), g12(1+Gamma*Gamma), nc(Nc) {
00688 
00689         a.normalize();
00690         g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00691 
00692         if (nc < 1) {
00693             nc=1;    // enforce nc >= 1
00694         }
00695         nreg = nc;                                  // one region per cone
00696         xo = new EGS_Vector[nc];                    // vector of cone apex positions
00697         xo[0] = Xo;                                 // apex of first cone
00698 
00699         // more than one cone
00700         if (nc > 1) {
00701             EGS_Float
00702             d_old = 0;
00703             d = new EGS_Float [nc-1];
00704             for (int j=1; j<nc; j++) {
00705                 d[j-1] = distances[j-1];
00706                 if (d[j-1] <= d_old) {
00707                     egsFatal("EGS_ParallelCones: " "distances must be in increasing order\n");
00708                 }
00709                 xo[j] = xo[0] + a*d[j-1];
00710                 d_old = d[j-1];
00711             }
00712         }
00713     }
00714 
00715     // destructor
00716     ~EGS_ParallelCones() {
00717         delete [] xo;
00718         if (nc > 1) {
00719             delete [] d;
00720         }
00721     }
00722 
00723     // isInside
00724     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00725         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[0]);                     // current position with respect to apex
00726         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                        // current axial position
00727         if (aa < 0) {
00728             return false;    // on "negative" side of cones
00729         }
00730         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();                // distance^2 to apex
00731         if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12) {
00732             return true;    // inside outer cone
00733         }
00734         return false;
00735     };
00736 
00737     // isWhere
00738     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00739         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[0]);                     // current position with respect to apex
00740         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                        // current axial position
00741         if (aa < 0) {
00742             return -1;    // on "negative" side of apex
00743         }
00744         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();                // distance^2 to apex
00745         if (r2 > aa*aa*g12) {
00746             return -1;    // outside outer cone
00747         }
00748         EGS_Float r2a2 = r2 - aa*aa;                // distance to cone set axis
00749         for (int j=0; j<nc-1; j++) {                // loop over all inner cones
00750             EGS_Float aj  = aa - d[j];              // distance to apex of cone j
00751             EGS_Float ajg = aj*gamma;               // length of cone j'th side up to aj
00752             if (aj < 0 || r2a2 > ajg*ajg) {
00753                 return j;    // on "negative" side or outside of cone j
00754             }
00755         }
00756         return nc-1;                                // then it must be in last cone
00757     }
00758 
00759     // inside
00760     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00761         return isWhere(x);
00762     }
00763 
00764     // howfar
00765     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t,
00766                int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00767 
00768         // not in innermost cone
00769         if (ireg < nc-1) {
00770             EGS_Vector xp;                          // a position
00771             bool hit = false;                       // howfar hit flag
00772 
00773             // apex position of "next" inner cone
00774             if (ireg < 0) {
00775                 xp = x-xo[0];    // apex of outer cone
00776             }
00777             else {
00778                 xp = x-xo[ireg+1];    // apex of next inner cone
00779             }
00780 
00781             // general solution
00782             EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                    // axial position in current cone
00783             EGS_Float b  = u*a;                     // cos(t), t = angle between a and u
00784             EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();            // distance^2 to current cone apex
00785             EGS_Float c  = u*xp;                    // projection of xp on u
00786             EGS_Float A  = 1 - b*b*g12;
00787             EGS_Float B  = c - aa*b*g12;
00788             EGS_Float C  = r2 - aa*aa*g12;
00789             EGS_Float tt = 1e30;
00790             EGS_Float lam = -1;
00791 
00792             // moving parallel to cone surface
00793             if (fabs(A) < 1e-6) {                   // guarding against /0 in general solution
00794                 EGS_Float ttt = -C/(2*B);           // distance to hit
00795                 lam = aa+b*ttt;                     // axial position of hit
00796                 if (ttt >= 0 && lam >= 0) {
00797                     tt  = ttt;
00798                     hit = true;
00799                 }
00800             }
00801             // general solution
00802             else {
00803                 EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
00804                 if (D >= 0 && !(A > 0 && B > 0)) {
00805                     EGS_Float ttt = B < 0 ? C/(sqrt(D)-B) : -(sqrt(D)+B)/A;
00806                     lam = aa+b*ttt;
00807                     if (ttt >= 0 && lam >= 0) {
00808                         tt = ttt;
00809                         hit = true;
00810                     }
00811                 }
00812             }
00813             if (tt <= t) {
00814                 int inew = ireg < 0 ? 0 : ireg+1;
00815                 t = tt;
00816                 if (newmed) {
00817                     *newmed = medium(inew);
00818                 }
00819                 if (normal) {
00820                     *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*g12);
00821                     normal->normalize();
00822                 }
00823                 return inew;
00824             }
00825             if (ireg < 0 || hit) {
00826                 return ireg;
00827             }
00828         }
00829 
00830         // inside and not hitting the next inner cone.
00831         // check the previous outer cone
00832         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[ireg]);
00833         EGS_Float aa = xp*a, b = u*a, r2 = xp.length2(), c = u*xp;
00834         EGS_Float A = 1 - b*b*g12, B = c - aa*b*g12, C = r2 - aa*aa*g12;
00835         EGS_Float to = 1e30, lamo = -1;
00836         if (fabs(A) < 1e-6) {  // moving parallel to the cone surface.
00837             // for the outer cone we only have a solution if a*u < 0.
00838             // i.e. if we are moving towards the apex.
00839             if (b < 0) {
00840                 EGS_Float ttt = -C/(2*B);
00841                 lamo = aa+b*ttt;
00842                 if (ttt >= 0 && lamo >= 0) {
00843                     to = ttt;
00844                 }
00845             }
00846         }
00847         else {
00848             EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
00849             // avoid numerical problems when |A*C| << |B|
00850             if (D >= 0 && !(A < 0 && B < 0)) {
00851                 EGS_Float ttt = B > 0 ? -C/(B+sqrt(D)) : (sqrt(D)-B)/A;
00852                 lamo = aa+b*ttt;
00853                 if (ttt >= 0 && lamo >= 0) {
00854                     to = ttt;
00855                 }
00856             }
00857         }
00858         if (to <= t) {
00859             t = to;
00860             int inew = ireg-1;
00861             if (newmed) {
00862                 *newmed = inew < 0 ? -1 : medium(inew);
00863             }
00864             if (normal) {
00865                 *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lamo*g12);
00866                 normal->normalize();
00867             }
00868             return inew;
00869         }
00870         return ireg;
00871     }
00872 
00873     // hownear
00874     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00875         EGS_Float tc;
00876         if (ireg < 0 || ireg < nc-1) {
00877             EGS_Vector xp;
00878             if (ireg < 0) {
00879                 xp = x - xo[0];
00880             }
00881             else {
00882                 xp = x - xo[ireg+1];
00883             }
00884             EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
00885             EGS_Float ag = aa*gamma;
00886             EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
00887             if (aa < 0 && ag*ag > r2*g12) {
00888                 tc = sqrt(r2);
00889             }
00890             else {
00891                 tc = fabs((ag-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*g12i);
00892             }
00893             if (ireg < 0) {
00894                 return tc;
00895             }
00896         }
00897         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[ireg]);
00898         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
00899         EGS_Float ag = aa*gamma;
00900         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
00901         EGS_Float tco = fabs((ag-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*g12i);
00902         return tco < tc ? tco : tc;
00903     }
00904 
00905     // getMaxStep
00906     int getMaxStep() const {
00907         return 2*nreg + 2;
00908     }
00909 
00910     // getType accessor
00911     const string &getType() const {
00912         return type;
00913     }
00914 
00915     // printInfo
00916     void printInfo() const;
00917 };
00918 
00919 
00920 // A set of cones having the same apex and axis but different opening angles.
00921 // If flag = 0, only cones below the apex.
00922 //         = 1, cones below and above the apex but excluding the space
00923 //              outside of the last cone
00924 //         = 2, all space
00925 
00969 class EGS_ConeSet : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00970 
00971     EGS_Vector    xo;   // the common apex.
00972     EGS_Vector    a;    // the axis.
00973     EGS_Float     *gamma, *g12, *g12i;
00974     int           nc;
00975     int           flag;
00976 
00977     static string type;
00978 
00979 public:
00980 
00981     EGS_ConeSet(const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, int Nc,
00982                 EGS_Float *Gamma, int Flag = 0, const string &Name = "") :
00983         EGS_BaseGeometry(Name), xo(Xo), a(A), flag(Flag) {
00984         a.normalize();
00985         if (Nc < 1) {
00986             egsFatal("EGS_ConeSet: number of cones must be positive\n");
00987         }
00988         nc = Nc;
00989         gamma = new EGS_Float [nc];
00990         g12 = new EGS_Float [nc];
00991         g12i = new EGS_Float [nc];
00992         if (flag < 0 || flag > 2) {
00993             egsWarning("EGS_ConeSet: flag must be 0,1 or 2, reseting to 0\n");
00994             flag = 0;
00995         }
00996         for (int j=0; j<nc; j++) {
00997             if (Gamma[j] <= 0) {
00998                 egsFatal("EGS_ConeSet: gamma's must be positive\n");
00999             }
01000             if (j > 0) {
01001                 if (Gamma[j] <= gamma[j-1]) egsFatal("EGS_ConeSet: "
01002                                                          "gamma's must be in increasing order\n");
01003             }
01004             gamma[j] = Gamma[j];
01005             g12[j] = 1 + gamma[j]*gamma[j];
01006             g12i[j] = 1/sqrt(g12[j]);
01007         }
01008         if (flag == 0) {
01009             nreg = nc;
01010         }
01011         else {
01012             nreg = 2*nc + 1;
01013         }
01014         if (flag == 1) {
01015             is_convex = false;
01016         }
01017     }
01018 
01019     ~EGS_ConeSet() {
01020         delete [] gamma;
01021         delete [] g12;
01022         delete [] g12i;
01023     }
01024 
01025     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
01026         if (flag == 2) {
01027             return true;
01028         }
01029         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);
01030         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
01031         if (flag == 0 && aa < 0) {
01032             return false;
01033         }
01034         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
01035         if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12[nc-1]) {
01036             return true;
01037         }
01038         return false;
01039     }
01040 
01041     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
01042         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);
01043         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
01044         if (flag == 0 && aa < 0) {
01045             return -1;
01046         }
01047         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
01048         int j;
01049         for (j=0; j<nc; j++) if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12[j]) {
01050                 break;
01051             }
01052         if (j < nc) {
01053             if (aa >= 0) {
01054                 return j;
01055             }
01056             return 2*nc-j;
01057         }
01058         if (flag != 2) {
01059             return -1;
01060         }
01061         return nc;
01062     }
01063 
01064     bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
01065         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg) {
01066             return false;
01067         }
01068         return flag != 1 ? true : (ireg != nc);
01069     }
01070 
01071     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
01072         return isWhere(x);
01073     }
01074 
01075     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
01076                EGS_Float &t, int *newmed = 0, EGS_Vector *normal = 0) {
01077         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);
01078         EGS_Float aa = xp*a, b = u*a, r2 = xp.length2(), c = u*xp;
01079         //if( debug ) egsWarning(" ireg = %d x = (%g,%g,%g) a = %g"
01080         //     " b = %g r2 = %g c = %g\n",ireg,x.x,x.y,x.z,aa,b,r2,c);
01081         if (!xp.length2()) {
01082             // handle odd case where position coincides with apex
01083             int inew = isWhere(xp + u);
01084             if (inew != ireg) {
01085                 t = 0;
01086                 if (normal) {
01087                     *normal = a;
01088                 }
01089                 if (newmed) {
01090                     *newmed = inew >= 0 ? medium(inew) : -1;
01091                 }
01092             }
01093             return inew;
01094         }
01095         if (ireg != 0 && ireg != 2*nc) {
01096             // Not in the inner-most cone.
01097             // If outside (ireg < 0 || flag=2 and ireg=nc), check for
01098             // intersection with the outer-most cone
01099             // If inside, check for intersection with the inner cone.
01100             EGS_Float gam12;
01101             if (ireg < 0 || ireg == nc) {
01102                 gam12 = g12[nc-1];
01103             }
01104             else {
01105                 gam12 = ireg < nc ? g12[ireg-1] : g12[2*nc-ireg-1];
01106             }
01107             EGS_Float A=1-b*b*gam12, B=c-aa*b*gam12, C=r2-aa*aa*gam12;
01108             //if( debug ) egsWarning(" gam12 = %g A = %g B = %g "
01109             //        "C = %g\n",gam12,A,B,C);
01110             EGS_Float tt = -1, lam;
01111             bool hit = false;
01112             if (fabs(A) < 1e-6) {
01113                 if ((ireg < nc && b > 0) || (ireg >= nc && b < 0)) {
01114                     tt = -C/(2*B);
01115                 }
01116             }
01117             else {
01118                 EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
01119                 if (D >= 0 && !(A > 0 && B > 0)) {
01120                     tt = B < 0 ? C/(sqrt(D)-B) : -(sqrt(D)+B)/A;
01121                 }
01122             }
01123             if (tt >= 0) {   // possible intersection
01124                 lam = aa+b*tt;
01125                 int inew;
01126                 if (ireg == nc || ireg == -1) {
01127                     // outside the outer-most cone.
01128                     // if flag=1 or flag=2, we are allowed to hit either
01129                     // of the two cones
01130                     if (flag) {
01131                         hit = true;
01132                         inew = lam >= 0 ? nc-1 : nc+1;
01133                     }
01134                     // if flag=0, we are allowed to hit only the lower
01135                     // cone (lam >= 0)
01136                     else if (!flag && lam>=0) {
01137                         hit = true;
01138                         inew = nc-1;
01139                     }
01140                 }
01141                 else {
01142                     // inside. In this case we are only allowed to hit
01143                     // the cone on the same side of the apex.
01144                     if (lam*aa >= 0) {
01145                         hit = true;
01146                         inew = lam >= 0 ? ireg-1 : ireg+1;
01147                     }
01148                 }
01149                 if (hit && tt <= t) {
01150                     t = tt;
01151                     if (newmed) {
01152                         *newmed = medium(inew);
01153                     }
01154                     if (normal) {
01155                         *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*gam12);
01156                         normal->normalize();
01157                     }
01158                     return inew;
01159                 }
01160             }
01161             if (ireg < 0 || ireg == nc || hit) {
01162                 return ireg;
01163             }
01164         }
01165         //EGS_Float gam12 = ireg < nc-1 ? g12[ireg] : g12[2*nc-ireg];
01166         EGS_Float gam12 = ireg < nc ? g12[ireg] : g12[2*nc-ireg];
01167         EGS_Float A=1-b*b*gam12, B=c-aa*b*gam12, C=r2-aa*aa*gam12;
01168         EGS_Float tt=-1;
01169         if (fabs(A) < 1e-6) {
01170             if ((ireg < nc && b < 0) || (ireg > nc && b > 0)) {
01171                 tt = -C/(2*B);
01172             }
01173         }
01174         else {
01175             EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
01176             // avoid numerical problems when |A*C| << |B|
01177             if (D >= 0 && !(A < 0 && B < 0)) {
01178                 tt = B > 0 ? -C/(B+sqrt(D)) : (sqrt(D)-B)/A;
01179             }
01180         }
01181         if (tt < 0) {
01182             return ireg;
01183         }
01184         EGS_Float lam = aa + b*tt;
01185         if ((ireg < nc && lam < 0) || (ireg > nc && lam > 0)) {
01186             return ireg;
01187         }
01188         if (tt <= t) {
01189             t = tt;
01190             int inew;
01191             if (ireg < nc) {
01192                 inew = ireg+1;
01193                 if (inew == nc && flag < 2) {
01194                     inew = -1;
01195                 }
01196             }
01197             else {
01198                 inew = ireg-1;
01199                 if (inew == nc && flag < 2) {
01200                     inew = -1;
01201                 }
01202             }
01203             if (newmed) {
01204                 *newmed = inew < 0 ? -1 : medium(inew);
01205             }
01206             if (normal) {
01207                 *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*gam12);
01208                 normal->normalize();
01209             }
01210             return inew;
01211         }
01212         return ireg;
01213     }
01214 
01215     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
01216         EGS_Float tc;
01217         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);
01218         EGS_Float aa = xp*a, r2 = xp.length2(), ag;
01219         //egsWarning("hownear: ireg = %d x = (%g,%g,%g) aa = %g r2 = %g\n",
01220         //        ireg,x.x,x.y,x.z,aa,r2);
01221         if (ireg != 0 && ireg != 2*nc) {
01222             int i;
01223             if (ireg < 0 || ireg == nc) {
01224                 i = nc-1;
01225             }
01226             else {
01227                 i = ireg < nc ? ireg-1 : 2*nc-ireg-1;
01228             }
01229             ag = aa*gamma[i];
01230             if (flag == 0 && aa < 0 && ag*ag > r2*g12[i]) {
01231                 tc = sqrt(r2);
01232             }
01233             else {
01234                 tc = fabs((fabs(ag)-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*g12i[i]);
01235             }
01236             //egsWarning(" i = %d ag = %g g12i = %g tc = %g\n",i,ag,g12i[i],tc);
01237             if (ireg < 0 || ireg == nc) {
01238                 return tc;
01239             }
01240         }
01241         EGS_Float gam12i;
01242         if (ireg < nc) {
01243             ag = aa*gamma[ireg];
01244             gam12i = g12i[ireg];
01245         }
01246         else {
01247             ag = -aa*gamma[2*nc-ireg];
01248             gam12i = g12i[2*nc-ireg];
01249         }
01250         EGS_Float tco = fabs((ag-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*gam12i);
01251         //egsWarning(" ag = %g tco = %g\n",ag,tco);
01252         return tco < tc ? tco : tc;
01253     }
01254 
01255     int getMaxStep() const {
01256         return 4*nreg + 2;
01257     }
01258 
01259     const string &getType() const {
01260         return type;
01261     }
01262 
01263     void printInfo() const;
01264 };
01265 
01266 //
01267 // A cone stack is a collection of cones with possible
01268 // different opening angles, apexes, etc., stacked together
01269 // This is very similar to the cone stack component module in BEAM
01270 //
01271 //
01272 #include <vector>
01273 using std::vector;
01274 
01333 class EGS_ConeStack : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
01334 
01335 public:
01336 
01337     // constructor (empty cone stack)
01338     EGS_ConeStack(const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, const string &Name)
01339         : xo(Xo), a(A), nl(0), nltot(0), nmax(0), same_Rout(true), Rout(0), Rout2(0),
01340           EGS_BaseGeometry(Name) {
01341         a.normalize();
01342     }
01343 
01344     // destructor
01345     ~EGS_ConeStack() {
01346         clear(true);
01347     }
01348 
01349     // add a layer
01350     void addLayer(EGS_Float thick, const vector<EGS_Float> &rtop,
01351                   const vector<EGS_Float> &rbottom,
01352                   const vector<string> &med_names);
01353 
01354     // get medium
01355     int medium(int ireg) const {
01356         int il = ireg/nmax;
01357         int ir = ireg - il*nmax;
01358         return cones[il][ir]->medium(0);
01359     }
01360 
01361     // isInside
01362     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
01363         EGS_Float p = x*a;
01364         if (p < pos[0] || p > pos[nl]) {
01365             return false;
01366         }
01367         int il = findRegion(p,nl+1,pos);
01368         return cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x);
01369     }
01370 
01371     // isWhere
01372     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
01373         EGS_Float p = x*a;
01374         if (p < pos[0] || p > pos[nl]) {
01375             return -1;
01376         }
01377         int il = findRegion(p,nl+1,pos);
01378         int ir = isWhere(il,x);
01379         return ir < 0 ? -1 : il*nmax+ir;
01380     }
01381 
01382     // inside
01383     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
01384         return isWhere(x);
01385     }
01386 
01387     // isRealRegion
01388     bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
01389         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg) {
01390             return false;
01391         }
01392         int il = ireg/nmax;
01393         int ir = ireg - il*nmax;
01394         return (ir < nr[il]);
01395     }
01396 
01397     // howfar
01398     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
01399                EGS_Float &t, int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
01400 
01401         EGS_Float xp = x*a;
01402         EGS_Float up = u*a;
01403         int dir;
01404 
01405         // inside conestack
01406         if (ireg >= 0) {
01407             EGS_Float tp;
01408             int il = ireg/nmax;                     // layer index
01409 
01410             // calculate distance to plane
01411             if (up > 0) {                           // u points along conestack axis
01412                 dir = 1;                            // positive direction
01413                 tp = (pos[il+1]-xp)/up;             // distance to 'next' plane
01414             }
01415             else if (up < 0) {                      // u points against conestack axis
01416                 dir = -1;                           // negative direction
01417                 tp = (pos[il]-xp)/up;               // distance to 'previous' plane
01418             }
01419             else {                                  // u is perpendicular to a (u*a = 0)
01420                 dir = 0;                            // null direction
01421                 tp = 1e30;                          // init to large distance
01422             }
01423             bool hitp = false;                      // assume we don't hit the plane
01424             if (tp <= t) {                          // check against maximum distance t
01425                 hitp = true;                        // we hit the plane
01426                 t = tp;                             // set t = distance to plane
01427             }
01428 
01429             // distance to outer cone
01430             int ir = ireg - il*nmax;                // cone index in current layer
01431             bool hitc = false;                      // assume we don't hit the cone
01432             int irnew = cones[il][ir]->howfar(0,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
01433             if (irnew < 0) {
01434                 hitc = true;                        // hit the next cone
01435                 irnew = ir < nr[il]-1 ? ir+1 : -1;  // next cone region, or -1 if beyond last cone
01436             }
01437 
01438             // distance to inner cone (for all but innermost cone)
01439             if (ir > 0) {
01440                 int irnew1 = cones[il][ir-1]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
01441                 if (!irnew1) {
01442                     hitc = true;                    // hit the previous cone
01443                     irnew = ir-1;                   // previous cone region
01444                 }
01445             }
01446 
01447             // hit a cone boundary
01448             if (hitc) {
01449                 if (irnew < 0) {
01450                     return irnew;    // we are moving out of conestack, return -1
01451                 }
01452                 if (newmed) {
01453                     *newmed = cones[il][irnew]->medium(0);
01454                 }
01455                 return il*nmax + irnew;
01456             }
01457 
01458             // did not hit a plane (nor a cone: should not happen!)
01459             if (!hitp) {
01460                 return ireg;
01461             }
01462 
01463             // change layer
01464             int ilnew = il + dir;                   // new layer index
01465             if (normal) {
01466                 *normal = dir > 0 ? a*(-1) : a;
01467             }
01468             if (ilnew < 0 || ilnew >= nl) {
01469                 return -1;    // beyond conestack bounding planes => outside
01470             }
01471 
01472             // next layer radii are congruent (add nmax to ireg)
01473             if (dir > 0 && flag[il] >= 2) {
01474                 if (newmed) {
01475                     *newmed = cones[il+1][ir]->medium(0);
01476                 }
01477                 return ireg+nmax;
01478             }
01479 
01480             // previous layer radii are congruent (subtract nmax from ireg)
01481             if (dir < 0 && (flag[il] == 1 || flag[il] == 3)) {
01482                 if (newmed) {
01483                     *newmed = cones[il-1][ir]->medium(0);
01484                 }
01485                 return ireg-nmax;
01486             }
01487 
01488             // figure out region index in new layer
01489             il += dir;                              // new layer index
01490             EGS_Vector tmp(x+u*t);                  // position of the hit on new layer
01491             ir = isWhere(il,tmp);                   // get region index in that layer
01492             if (ir<0) {
01493                 return ir;    // moved out of constack
01494             }
01495             if (newmed) {
01496                 *newmed = cones[il][ir]->medium(0);
01497             }
01498             return il*nmax+ir;                      // return overall new region index
01499         }
01500 
01501         // outside of conestack
01502 
01503         EGS_Float  ttot=0;                          // cumulative travel distance
01504         EGS_Float  tp;                              // distance to next plane
01505         EGS_Vector tmp(x);                          // running position
01506         int il;                                     // current layer index
01507 
01508         // outside the first boundary plane
01509         if (xp <= pos[0]) {
01510             if (up <= 0) {
01511                 return ireg;    // moving away from conestack: no hit
01512             }
01513             tp = (pos[0]-xp)/up;                    // distance to first boundary plane
01514             if (tp > t) {
01515                 return ireg;    // distance greater than maximum t: no hit
01516             }
01517             tmp += u*tp;                            // move to first plane
01518             ttot = tp;                              // increase cumulative travel distance
01519             il   = 0;                               // index of current layer
01520             int ir = isWhere(0, tmp);               // region index in first layer
01521             if (ir >= 0) {                          // hit inside a cone in first layer: we're done
01522                 //***************************************************************
01523                 // EMH April 12 2013: Called from outside, but isWhere reports it is inside.
01524                 // This is due to either the particle at a boundary or to round-off errors near a boundary.
01525                 // To avoid getting into an infinite loop, check again if particle exits
01526                 // the geometry from region ir.
01527                 //
01528                 // FT December 4 2013:
01529                 // this isWhere call is using the tmp position and the LOCAL ir region number in
01530                 // layer 0 of the ConeStack, so it is not inconsistent if x is outside and ir>=0.
01531                 // BUT indeed we may be glancing on a "corner" of the ConeStack, so we should still
01532                 // check if a subsequent call to howfar(ir,tmp,...) takes us outside within epsilon.
01533                 // It that case we are not really entering the geometry.
01534                 EGS_Float tb = 1e30;
01535                 int inew_g = howfar(ir,tmp,u,tb,0,normal);
01536                 if (inew_g < 0 && tb <= epsilon) {
01537                     return ireg;    // exits geometry
01538                 }
01539                 //***************************************************************
01540                 t = tp;                             // distance to hit is distance to plane
01541                 if (newmed) {
01542                     *newmed = cones[0][ir]->medium(0);
01543                 }
01544                 if (normal) {
01545                     *normal = a*(-1);
01546                 }
01547                 return ir;                          // return region number
01548             }
01549         }
01550 
01551         // outside the last boundary plane
01552         else if (xp >= pos[nl]) {
01553             if (up >= 0) {
01554                 return ireg;    // moving away from the conestack: no hit
01555             }
01556             tp = (pos[nl]-xp)/up;                   // distance to last boundary plane
01557             if (tp > t) {
01558                 return ireg;    // distance greater than maximum t: no hit
01559             }
01560             tmp += u*tp;                            // hit position on last plane
01561             ttot = tp;                              // increase cumulative travel distance
01562             il = nl-1;                              // index of last plane
01563             int ir = isWhere(il, tmp);              // region index in last layer
01564             if (ir >= 0) {                          // hit inside a cone in first layer: we're done
01565                 //***************************************************************
01566                 // EMH April 12 2013: Called from outside, but isWhere reports it is inside.
01567                 // This is due to either the particle at a boundary or to round-off errors near a boundary.
01568                 // To avoid getting into an infinite loop, check again if particle exits
01569                 // the geometry from region ir.
01570                 //
01571                 // FT December 4 2013:
01572                 // this isWhere call is using the tmp position and the LOCAL ir region number in
01573                 // layer il of the ConeStack, so it is not inconsistent if x is outside and ir>=0.
01574                 // BUT indeed we may be glancing on a "corner" of the ConeStack, so we should still
01575                 // check if a subsequent call to howfar(il*nmax+ir) takes us outside within epsilon.
01576                 // It that case we are not really entering the geometry.
01577                 EGS_Float tb = 1e30;
01578                 int inew_g = howfar(il*nmax+ir,tmp,u,tb,0,normal);
01579                 if (inew_g < 0 && tb <= epsilon) {
01580                     return ireg;    // exits geometry
01581                 }
01582                 //***************************************************************
01583                 t = tp;                             // distance to hit is distance to plane
01584                 if (newmed) {
01585                     *newmed = cones[il][ir]->medium(0);
01586                 }
01587                 if (normal) {
01588                     *normal = a;    // set normal
01589                 }
01590                 return il*nmax+ir;                  // return region number
01591             }
01592         }
01593 
01594         // outside conestack, but within conestack boundary planes
01595         else {
01596 
01597             if (same_Rout) {
01598                 // all outer "cones" are actually cylinders and all have the same radius. This
01599                 // simplifies the logic a lot: just need to check against outer cylindrical cone of
01600                 // the first layer: cones[0][nr[0]-1]. Don't forget to use temporary and normal
01601                 // pointers here so that normal is only updated if the hit lies within the
01602                 // conestack boundary planes!
01603 
01604                 EGS_Float tt = t;
01605                 EGS_Vector tmp_normal;
01606 
01607                 //***************************************************************
01608                 // EMH, April 12 2013: To prevent round-off error situations
01609                 // where particles are stuck near boundaries or when a particle
01610                 // seats at a boundary, check both, where it is, and whether it exits
01611                 // the geometry. irnow SHOULD be -1, but if a particle is at a boundary or
01612                 // very close to one, isWhere returns irnow >= 0 values.
01613                 int irnow = isWhere(x);// irnow > 0 indicates round-off error near boundary
01614                 // irnow = -1 indicates proper call from outside
01615                 // howfar call using irnow instead of -1 in the hope particle gets out of boundary
01616                 //
01617                 // int irnew = cones[0][nr[0]-1]->howfar(irnow,x,u,tt,0,&tmp_normal);
01618                 //
01619                 // FT December 10 2013:
01620                 // the howfar call above does not work because it uses irnow for the call to
01621                 // SimpleCone->howfar: SimpleCone regions can only be 0 (inside) or -1 (outside).
01622                 // If we find the inconsistent condition irnow >= 0 (inside, but call from outside),
01623                 // then we are on a boundary. We see if howfar takes us out within epsilon.
01624                 // If so, then we are not really entering the geometry.
01625 
01626                 // fp inconsistency: irnow >= 0 (inside) but called with ireg = -1 (outside)
01627                 if (irnow >= 0) {
01628                     EGS_Float tb = 1e30;
01629                     int inew_g = howfar(irnow,x,u,tb,0,&tmp_normal);
01630                     if (inew_g < 0 && tb <= epsilon) {
01631                         return ireg;    // exits geometry
01632                     }
01633                 }
01634                 //***************************************************************
01635 
01636                 int irnew = cones[0][nr[0]-1]->howfar(ireg,x,u,tt,0,&tmp_normal);
01637 
01638                 if (irnew < 0) {
01639                     return -1;    // no hit
01640                 }
01641                 EGS_Float aux = xp + up*tt;         // axis position of hit point on outer cylinder
01642                 if (aux < pos[0] || aux > pos[nl] ||// beyond conestack bounding planes
01643                         (aux == pos[0]  && up <= 0)   ||// on first plane, going out
01644                         (aux == pos[nl] && up >= 0)) {  // on last plane, going out
01645                     return -1;                      // => no hit: we're done
01646                 }
01647                 il = findRegion(aux,nl+1,pos);      // layer index for axis position aux
01648                 if (newmed) {
01649                     *newmed = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->medium(0);
01650                 }
01651                 if (normal) {
01652                     *normal = tmp_normal;    // set normal to normal from howfar
01653                 }
01654                 t = tt;                             // set distance
01655                 return il*nmax + nr[il]-1;          // return region index
01656             }
01657 
01658             // get layer index for current position, projected on the conestack axis
01659             il = findRegion(xp,nl+1,pos);
01660 
01661             // guard agains round-off errors by checking if the position
01662             // is inside the outer cone in this layer (it shouldn't be, as the
01663             // particle is outside) and returning if it is.
01664             bool isc = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x);
01665             if (isc) {
01666                 // IK, March 7 2008: same problem as in CD geometry.
01667                 // we think we are outside but we just found we are inside.
01668                 // Hopefully a roundoff problem.
01669                 EGS_Float tp = 1e30;
01670                 if (up > 0) {
01671                     dir = 1;
01672                     tp = (pos[il+1] - xp)/up;
01673                 }
01674                 else if (up < 0) {
01675                     dir = -1;
01676                     tp = (pos[il] - xp)/up;
01677                 }
01678                 if (tp < epsilon) {
01679                     il += dir;
01680                     if (il < 0 || il >= nl) {
01681                         return ireg;
01682                     }
01683                     isc = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x);
01684                 }
01685 
01686                 if (isc) {
01687                     EGS_Float tc = 1e30;
01688                     int isc_new = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->howfar(0,x,u,tc);
01689                     if (!(isc_new < 0 && tc < epsilon)) {
01690                         egsWarning("EGS_ConeStack::howfar: called from the outside"
01691                                    " but I find x=(%g,%g,%g) to be inside\n", x.x,x.y,x.z);
01692                         egsWarning("layer=%d distance to planes=%g\n",il,tp);
01693                         egsWarning("distance to outer cone=%g\n",tc);
01694                         error_flag = 1;
01695                         return ireg;
01696                     }
01697                 }
01698             }
01699         }
01700 
01701         // traverse layers until we hit a cone, or else move beyond conestack boundary planes
01702         while (1) {
01703 
01704             // calculate distance to next plane boundary
01705             if (up > 0) {                           // moving along conestack axis a
01706                 dir = 1;                            // positive direction
01707                 tp = (pos[il+1] - xp)/up;           // total distance to next plane
01708             }
01709             else if (up < 0) {                      // moving against conestack axis a
01710                 dir = -1;                           // negative direction
01711                 tp = (pos[il] - xp)/up;             // total distance to previous plane
01712             }
01713             else {                                  // moving perpendicular to axis (u*a = 0)
01714                 dir = 0;                            // null direction
01715                 tp  = 1e30;                         // init to large distance
01716             }
01717 
01718             // distance to outer cone in layer 'il'
01719             EGS_Float tt = t - ttot;                // remaining maximum distance
01720             int tmp_med;
01721             EGS_Vector tmp_normal;
01722             int irnew = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->howfar(-1,tmp,u,tt,&tmp_med,&tmp_normal);
01723             if (!irnew) {                           // hit the outer cone
01724                 if (tp > ttot + tt) {               // plane is further than cone: we're done
01725                     t = ttot+tt;                    // final distance to conestack
01726                     if (newmed) {
01727                         *newmed = tmp_med;    // set media
01728                     }
01729                     if (normal) {
01730                         *normal = tmp_normal;    // set normal
01731                     }
01732                     return il*nmax+nr[il]-1;        // return final region index
01733                 }
01734             }
01735             if (tp > t || !dir) {
01736                 break;    // guard against glancing hits
01737             }
01738             il += dir;                              // move to previous or next layer
01739             if (il < 0 || il >= nl) {
01740                 break;    // enforce conestack bounding planes
01741             }
01742             ttot = tp;                              // increase cumulative travel distance
01743             tmp = x + u*tp;                         // move along to position hit on next plane
01744 
01745             int itest = isWhere(il,tmp);            // check where we are in next layer
01746             if (itest >= 0) {                       // we are inside a cone in next layer
01747                 t = ttot;                           // update distance
01748                 if (newmed) {
01749                     *newmed = cones[il][itest]->medium(0);
01750                 }
01751                 if (normal) {
01752                     *normal = dir > 0 ? a*(-1) : a;
01753                 }
01754                 return il*nmax + itest;             // return final region index
01755             }
01756         }
01757         return ireg;
01758     }
01759 
01760     // hownear
01761     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
01762 
01763         EGS_Float xp = x*a;                         // current position along the axis
01764         EGS_Float tp, tc;                           // distances
01765 
01766         // inside the conestack
01767         if (ireg >= 0) {
01768             int il = ireg/nmax;                     // current layer index
01769             int ir = ireg - il*nmax;                // region index in current layer
01770             tp = min(xp-pos[il],pos[il+1]-xp);      // min of distance to planes on either side
01771             tc = cones[il][ir]->hownear(0,x);       // distance to outer conical boundary
01772             if (ir > 0) {
01773                 tc = min(tc,cones[il][ir-1]->hownear(-1,x));    // to inner conical boundary
01774             }
01775             return min(tp,tc);                      // return minimum distance
01776         }
01777 
01778         // outside the conestack; just check distances to layer planes, which is overkill, but in
01779         // general it would be worse to check hownear on the outer cones in all layer! To mitigate
01780         // hownear calls to layer planes, one can inscribe the conestack in a fitting envelope.
01781 
01782         if (xp <= pos[0]) {
01783             return pos[0] - xp;    // distance to first layer plane
01784         }
01785         if (xp >= pos[nl]) {
01786             return xp - pos[nl];    // distance to last layer plane
01787         }
01788         int il = findRegion(xp,nl+1,pos);           // find current layer index
01789         tp = min(xp-pos[il],pos[il+1]-xp);          // min of distance to planes on either side
01790         return min(tp,cones[il][nr[il]-1]->hownear(-1,x));  // min dist. to planes and outer cone
01791 
01792     }
01793 
01794     // getMaxStep
01795     int getMaxStep() const {
01796         int nstep = 0;
01797         for (int j=0; j<nl; ++j) {
01798             nstep += 2*nr[j] + 1;
01799         }
01800         return nstep + 1;
01801     }
01802 
01803     // getType
01804     const string &getType() const {
01805         return type;
01806     }
01807 
01808     // printInfo
01809     void printInfo() const;
01810 
01811     // nLayer
01812     int  nLayer() const {
01813         return nl;
01814     }
01815 
01816     // shiftLabels
01817     void shiftLabelRegions(const int i, const int index) {
01818         for (int k=0; k<labels[i].regions.size(); k++) {
01819             labels[i].regions[k] += index*nmax;
01820         }
01821     }

01825 protected:
01826 
01827     EGS_Vector  xo;             // the position of the top layer
01828     EGS_Vector  a;              // the axis
01829     int         nl;             // number of layers
01830     int         nltot;          // size of the arrays
01831     int         nmax;           // max. number of radii in all layers
01832     bool        same_Rout;      // true, if all layers have same outer radius
01833     EGS_Float   Rout, Rout2;    // outer radius (if same_Rout is true)
01834     EGS_Float   *pos;           // the plane positions dividing the layers
01835     int         *nr;            // number of radii in each layer
01836     int         *flag;          // a flag for each layer:
01837     //   = 0 -> top and bottom radii different from adjacent layers
01838     //   = 1 -> top radii are the same as bottom of previous layer
01839     //   = 2 -> bottom radii are the same as top of next layer
01840     //   = 3 -> top and bottom radii same as adjacent layers
01841     EGS_SimpleCone ** *cones;   // the cones for each layer.
01842     static string type;
01843 
01844     // resize
01845     void resize();
01846 
01847     // clear
01848     void clear(bool);
01849 
01850     // isWhere
01851     inline int isWhere(int il, const EGS_Vector &x) {
01852         if (!cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x)) {
01853             return -1;
01854         }
01855         for (int j=0; j<nr[il]-1; j++) {
01856             if (cones[il][j]->isInside(x)) {
01857                 return j;
01858             }
01859         }
01860         return nr[il]-1;
01861     }
01862 };
